glosses: an award conferred by a college or university signifying that the recipient has satisfactorily completed a course of study

an academic degree is a college or university diploma, often associated with a title and sometimes associated with an academic position, which is usually awarded in recognition of the recipient having either satisfactorily completed a prescribed course of study or having conducted a scholarly endeavor deemed worthy of his or her admission to the degree.
an award bestowed by a university or, in some countries, a college, as an indication of academic achievement or occasionally bestowed to honor its recipient.
an award conferred by a college, university, or other postsecondary education institution as official recognition for the successful completion of a program of studies. (source: umls)

a stage of proficiency or qualification in a course of study, now especially an award bestowed by a university or, in some countries, a college, as a certification of academic achievement. (in the united states, can include secondary schools.)
a university degree, such as an msc or phd, awarded after a baccalaureate on completion of a further program of academic studies.
